Description: Pair of earrings: made from thin copper wire, each twisted into a spiral of five circuits. Although the ends of each spiral are damaged it appears that each ear-ring had one pointed and one blunt end.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Mostagedda, Grave 2639 Found at each ear.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 134; pl. XXXV, 10; Tomb register, pl.LXX.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (572)
